channel.title: Need For Speed: World
channel.description:
So I've been playing this game for a couple days, and it's awesome.
[IMG height=500]http://i40.tinypic.com/9v8dat.jpg[/img]
I'm really indecisive about it's look lmao, 3rd paint job and 4th vinyl job. Amazing drag racing vehicle. Worst handling ever right now, currently I'm saving up for a camaro to be my next vehicle, it's $500,000 lol, hence the large amount of cash sitting up there. Chasing achievements and racing every chance I get.
It's a racing MMO, you can drive around and do the daily treasure hunts, drive around with friends, see others cars and stuff, etc. etc. Then you of course can race, to team police pursuit escapes, and also do single-player events.
If you end up trying out lemme know and we can race or something, it's an amazing game. It's free to play, forgot to mention that. It's not very pay2win, contrary to what people say you can only buy cars and cosmetic parts with the bought currency, and cars all have their own race classes so I won't get teamed up with a Ferrari or anything.
p.s Don't use the origin launcher, it's really, really buggy. Just download the one from their site.

item.title: Need For Speed: World
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

If it stops getting boring and you need a boost just hit up mpgh and grab some fun tools and go obliterate everyone in-game. I like it for the car customizing and sometimes racing with non-hackers, just depends really.

Read full topic

item.title: Need For Speed: World
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

I played the game for one day, It was fun for like 1 hour then I got sick of it.

Read full topic

item.title: Need For Speed: World
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

ea.com – 14 Feb 18

Need for Speed Payback - Car Racing Action Game - Official EA Site

Official site of Need for Speed Payback, an action driving fantasy that's the newest game in the popular car racing video game franchise, Need for Speed.

Looks pretty pay2win to me. I played it a while back but the fact that I knew that the things I worked for, others hadn’t worked for, put me off.

Read full topic

item.title: Need For Speed: World
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

HcoJustin:

The game quickly turned into a money whore pay2win game after it went free to play. That 500k camaro used to cost like 35k when people were paying monthly.

Yeah well, it is made by EA. It’s still fun though.

Read full topic
